text.0: he hath sent forth bright radiant and refulgent like the dawns lover his farspreading lustre.
text.1: pure in his splendour shines the golden hero our longing thoughts hath he aroused and wakened.
text.2: he like the sun hath shone while morn is breaking and priests who weave the sacrifice sing praises.
text.3: agni the god who knows their generations and visits gods most bounteous rapid envoy.
text.4: our songs and holy hymns go forth to agni seeking the god and asking him for riches.
text.5: him fair to see of goodly aspect mighty mens messenger who carries their oblations.
text.6: joined with the vasus agni bring thou indra bring hither mighty rudra with the rudras.
text.7: aditi good to all men with Ādityas bṛhaspati allbounteous with the singers.
text.8: men eagerly implore at sacrifices agni most youthful god the joyous herald.
text.9: for he is lord and ruler over riches and for gods worship an unwearied envoy.
